result.markdown:
---
title: "Directed Acyclic Graphs"
---


##Assignment

::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_b018a68644ffa0be738dfda155202587'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(dagitty)
library(ggdag)
dag <- dagify(
  X ~ Z,
  Y ~ Z,
  Y ~ X,
  coords = list(x = c(Y = 3, Z = 2, X = 1),
                y = c(Y = 0, Z = 1, X = 0)),
  labels = list(X = "Parking spots",
                Y = "Sales",
                Z = "Customers")
)

# Plot DAG
ggdag(dag) +
  geom_dag_text(color = "white") +
  geom_dag_edges(edge_color = "black") +
  geom_dag_label_repel(aes(label = label))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_a3f112b7650ae748fb14eb3edf96cb02'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Load necessary libraries
library(ggplot2)
library(dagitty)

# Load the data
data <- readRDS("C:\\Users\\Deniz\\Documents\\GitHub\\Causal_Data_Science_Data\\customer_sat.rds")

# Explore the data
head(data)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 6 Ã— 3

```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
summary(data)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
   follow_ups      satisfaction   subscription      
 Min.   : 0.000   Min.   :40.00   Length:15         
 1st Qu.: 2.500   1st Qu.:48.50   Class :character  
 Median : 7.000   Median :60.00   Mode  :character  
 Mean   : 5.667   Mean   :60.13                     
 3rd Qu.: 8.000   3rd Qu.:72.00                     
 Max.   :10.000   Max.   :80.00                     
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Regression without accounting for subscription
model1 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = data)
summary(model1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = data)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-12.412  -5.257   1.733   4.506  12.588 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  78.8860     4.2717  18.467 1.04e-10 ***
follow_ups   -3.3093     0.6618  -5.001 0.000243 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 7.923 on 13 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.658,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.6316 
F-statistic: 25.01 on 1 and 13 DF,  p-value: 0.0002427
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# Regression accounting for subscription
model2 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = data)
summary(model2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = data)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-4.3222 -2.1972  0.3167  2.2667  3.9944 

Coefficients:
                     Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)           26.7667     6.6804   4.007  0.00206 ** 
follow_ups             2.1944     0.7795   2.815  0.01682 *  
subscriptionPremium   44.7222     5.6213   7.956 6.88e-06 ***
subscriptionPremium+  18.0722     2.1659   8.344 4.37e-06 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 2.958 on 11 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.9597,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.9487 
F-statistic: 87.21 on 3 and 11 DF,  p-value: 5.956e-08
```
:::
:::

Model 1:

Intercept = 78.9

Follow-up coefficient = -3.3

Model 2:

Intercept = 26.8

Follow-up coefficient = 2.2
Subscription Premium coefficient = 44.7
Subscription Premium+ coefficient = 18.1


In the model without accounting for subscription (model1), the negative coefficient for follow-up calls suggests that more follow-up calls are associated with lower satisfaction. However, this might be confounded by the type of subscription.

In the model accounting for subscription (model2), the positive coefficient for follow-up calls suggests that, after accounting for subscription type, more follow-up calls are associated with higher satisfaction.

The positive coefficients for the "Premium" and "Premium+" subscription levels suggest that clients with these subscriptions tend to report higher satisfaction compared to the reference level.



::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_f7b941e7d0361e29dea8c1f5bd238552'}

```{.r .cell-code}
# Plot the data
ggplot(data, aes(x = follow_ups, y = satisfaction, color = subscription)) +
  geom_point(size = 3) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  labs(title = "Relationship Between Follow-up Calls and Satisfaction",
       x = "Number of Follow-up Calls",
       y = "Satisfaction") +
  theme_minimal()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'
```
:::
